record.name: suppose
record.explain: v.（根据所知）认为；推断；料想

record.name: nasty
record.explain: adj.令人厌恶的；令人不悦的

subrecord.name: Dear friends
Trees are our friends. They work hard for us.
They clean the air and cool our cities.
They remove dust and produce the oxygen we breathe.
Trees reduce sound pollution for large urban areas and add beauty to cities.
Without trees, soil would be washed away and there would be no food for us to eat.
Without trees cooling the air, the Earth would be too hot to live on.
Trees provide food and shelter for both humans and animals.
They also supply material for houses, furniture, paper products, etc.
Some trees even provide important ingredients for medicines that cure illnesses.
Without trees, we would die.
In the last 200 years, more than half of all the trees on the Earth have been destroyed.
For every tree being planted today, 30 trees are being cut down.
We need more trees!
Trees for life is making a difference.
We plant trees and take care of them to help protect our environment.
We warmly welcome anyone who would like to join us in this project.
We want to plant 100 million trees in the next 10 years.
If you want to find out more about us, please send us an e-mail at info@treesforlife.org.
We hope you will have lots of fun with us.
From
TREES FOR LIFE
Why are you so interested in trees, Doctor Ray?
They're the biggest and oldest living things on the Earth, Judy.
Yes, but what good are trees? They make streets more beautiful and less noisy, but what else can they do?
Well, the wood in your pencil, the rubber on the end of your pencil, the paper in your notebook and the fruit in your bowl all come from trees! And, I suppose you also enjoy breathing pure, cool air.
Of course.
Then you must thank trees for that too. They take harmful gases from the air, and release oxygen back into the air. How many people are there in your class, Judy?
Forty-six.
Well, one and a half hectares of trees could produce enough oxygen to keep your whole class alive and healthy for a whole year.
That's wonderful!
Trees cool the air as well as clean it. They are natural air conditioners. Three trees can do the job of 15 air conditioners running almost all day.
You certainly know a lot about trees, Doctor Ray.

Thank you, Judy, but I don't, really. Scientists are only now beginning to understand them. For example, when insects attack a tree, it can warn its neighbours. The trees can then protect themselves by producing a chemical that makes their leaves taste nasty. And some trees can join their roots together underground, and pass food and water to each other. Trees are communicating with one another, but we don't know how.
Are trees in danger?
In great danger. We cut down and burn millions every year, but we replace hardly any of them. We are destroying our best fighters against pollution.
Vanda and Linda from Xishuangbanna, Yunnan, were very special contestants at last year's China's Got Talent.
The little sisters sang a beautiful song called Endless Flowers, and even had a five-year-old elephant dance for their performance.
The song is about their love for the tropical rainforest in their hometown.
People were moved by the song, but the story of the little sisters' family was even more touching.
Linda and Vanda's father was the late German biologist and rainforest expert Josef Margraf.
His passion for biodiversity and the environment began at the age of 18.
By 1989, he had succeeded in creating a new way to recover and renew the rainforests, which rewrote the textbooks on rainforest protection in the Philippines.
For that he was given a Philippine Presidential Award in 1997.
In the same year, he was assigned by the European Union to lead a panel on a rainforest protection project in Xishuangbanna for six years.
Eventually Margraf left the panel and decided to rescue the world on his own.
In 2000, Margraf met Li Minguo and they got married soon.
Their love for nature brought the couple closer together.
They set up Seeds of Heaven & Beyond Biodiversity Development Center in Yunnan.
They rented 10,667 square meters of land along the Lancang River.
During that time, no other people lived within 100 kilometers and the place was wild and remote, ruled by rubber trees previously planted by humans who had left.
They cut down the rubber trees and planted thousands of different plants.
Official statistics showed, in the past 50 years, the temperature difference between seasons in Xishuangbanna has increased while the relative humidity decreased.
Rubber trees draw great amount of water from underground to make themselves grow, just like a pump.
No other plant can survive near rubber trees.
The rubber industry brings money, but the growth of the rubber has already caused water resources to drop in Yunnan.
It also destroys biodiversity.
Actually, any single species dominating an environment is a disaster.
So there shouldn't be any large-scale single crop industry in the rainforest.
Until his death, Margraf stayed in China to discover nearly extinct species and helped establish a biodiversity system in the rainforest region in Southwestern China.
But now it is all up to Li Minguo.
'This was a life-subject for Josef.
It is a great honor for me,' said Li.

part.name: Restoring paradise
part.article: Vanda and Linda from Xishuangbanna, Yunnan, were very special contestants at last year's China's Got Talent. The little sisters sang a beautiful song called Endless Flowers, and even had a five-year-old elephant dance for their performance. The song is about their love for the tropical rainforest in their hometown. People were moved by the song, but the story of the little sisters' family was even more touching. Linda and Vanda's father was the late (已故的) German biologist and rainforest expert Josef Margraf (马悠). His passion for biodiversity (生物多样性) and the environment began at the age of 18. By 1989, he had succeeded in creating a new way to recover and renew the rainforests, which rewrote the textbooks on rainforest protection in the Philippines (菲律宾). For that he was given a Philippine Presidential Award in 1997. In the same year, he was assigned by the European Union to lead a panel (专门小组) on a rainforest protection project in Xishuangbanna for six years. Eventually Margraf left the panel and decided to rescue the world on his own. In 2000, Margraf met Li Minguo (李旻果) and they got married soon. Their love for nature brought the couple closer together. They set up Seeds of Heaven & Beyond Biodiversity Development Center (天籽生物多样性发展中心) in Yunnan. They rented 10,667 square meters of land along the Lancang River (澜沧江，湄公河上游在中国境内河段的名称). During that time, no other people lived within 100 kilometers and the place was wild and remote, ruled by rubber trees previously planted by humans who had left. They cut down the rubber trees and planted thousands of different plants. Official statistics (数据) showed, in the past 50 years, the temperature difference between seasons in Xishuangbanna has increased while the relative humidity (湿度) decreased. Rubber trees draw great amount of water from underground to make themselves grow, just like a pump (抽水机). No other plant can survive near rubber trees. The rubber industry brings money, but the growth of the rubber has already caused water resources to drop in Yunnan. It also destroys biodiversity. Actually, any single species dominating an environment is a disaster. So there shouldn't be any large-scale (大规模的) single crop industry in the rainforest. Until his death, Margraf stayed in China to discover nearly extinct species and helped establish a biodiversity system in the rainforest region in Southwestern China. But now it is all up to Li Minguo. "This was a life-subject for Josef. It is a great honor for me," said Li.

section.name: Choose the best answer.
section.question: Linda and Vanda sang Endless Flowers at last year’s China’s Got Talent to ______.

According to the passage, what happened to Josef Margraf in 1997? ① He developed an interest in biodiversity and the environment. ② He found a new way to recover and renew the rainforests. ③ He received a Philippine Presidential Award. ④ He was assigned by the European Union to lead a panel on a rainforest protection project in Xishuangbanna.
Too many rubber trees planted in one area may cause ______.
The area Josef Margraf and Li Minguo rented ______.
______ is a good way to maintain the biodiversity in an area.
